item.title: To test or not to test
item.author: diegojromerolopez@gmail.com (Diego J. Romero-López)
item.description: Introduction Some years ago I did not use any tests. We were cowboys in CodeWest where only fearful and strong people survive. Sometimes we tested some actions and assumed that everything else worked fine. But for the most part, code where developed almost like our sub-conscience dictated us what to type: we were guided by instinct. Of course, users of my applications were not so amused by this when they found software faulted and had to wait to me to repair it.
